projects.name: The Tale of Zelmore
projects.description: The Tales of Zelmore is a 2 player fighting game I made in collaboration with my friend Garrett for a class at UCSC. The assignment was to create a real version of a video game from a tv show or movie. We chose The Tales of Zelmore from the tv show The Amazing World of Gumball. We had 2 weeks to make this project
contribution: I programmed the hero character controller and state machine
I drew all of the hero's animations and title screen visuals using Piskel
highlights: I crafted a compelx player state machine with states and routines that could be interrupted by certain events, like being stunned
I programmed hitboxes and hurtboxes to handel attacks between the characters

projects.name: A Tail of Two Tides
projects.description: The Tail of Two Tides is a Rythm game I made with 3 other friends for the GMTK 2024 Summer Game Jam. The player has to hit the notes in a guitar hero style, then swap to collect notes, like coins in subway surfers. The player wins if they complete all four rounds.
contribution: I programmed the dog pirates movement.
I also programmed the obstacles and the notes for the dog pirate in a simple way to the person in charge of syncing them to the music could easily spawn them with a function call.
highlights: I created a routine-based movement system that would move the player from one lane to another when they input a direction. They are able to change their mind mid-move, to move back to where they came from.
When programming the obstacle instatiation, I put it into one easy function that included documentation. This made it easy for my partner to sync the obstacle instantiation to the music

projects.name: Pixelation Tool
projects.description: This is a tool I made for my friend's tool Jam. I really like retro game aesthetics and sometimes I have trouble making game assets so I made a tool that crunches images down and applies a palette to them. The user can upload a photo, slide the block size to the right to make the image more pixelated, then they can apply a palette to the image.
contribution: I programmed all aspectes of this projects.
skillsDemonstrated: Using HTML canvases to modify images
